intro: Hieracium exacuticeps, commonly known as the sharp-headed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a single inflorescence, blooming from June to August. Hieracium exacuticeps is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed sites, and it plays a role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
